Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: vanillaaface
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in July. The reason we chose this hotel was for its central location. The staff were very helpful although some struggled with English. They helped with directions, provided a map and helped with any issues we had, which were minimal. The hotel as a whole looked and felt like Rome. Although the facilities were a little dated we really enjoyed the feel of the place. The breakfast was nothing special but was fine for us, what you would usually expect in a European hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean, with a nice bathroom. There wasnt really a view only the road outside. Again some of the facilities were dated and we had to carry our bags up the stairs because the lift was too small. This didn’t bother me too much and there are ground floor rooms if it was a problem. The location is what really impressed us, we didn’t use any form of transport as everywhere was in walking distance from the hotel. In my opinion walking is the best way to see a city and this hotel is great for that. Other that the Vatican all the major attractions are literally all within 20 min walk away. Even the Vatican was only just over 1 hours walk away with the bridges and the castle on the way so if you can read a map try the walk to the Vatican, it was really enjoyable. The restaurants right by the hotel were brilliant and I would even go as far to say the best food in Europe, but that’s down to my personal taste for Italian food. The hotel is a little more expensive than others but for the location it was definitely worth it! Happy holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fordsask24
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with all aspects of our stay at Domus Romana. The breakfast was large and of good quality. Most sights were within walking distance(only used the metro twice in two weeks). Most importantly however was the generosity and friendliness of the staff members. They were always there to answer any questions that we had. As well the rooms were spacious as were the bathrooms, and our room included a kitchen which was super handy. The Domus Romana exceeded any of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Three day trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ian J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Due to a train strike only stayed two nights rather than three at the Domus Romana. Great location in Rome for both the sights and Termini station. Nice big room with a kitchenette (not used or wanted), clean shower room etc. Beds were a bit hard and as we were on the front, a bit noisy from the street - but slept OK as tired from stomping the streets. Good buffet-style breakfast although the room used is a bit small. Plenty to do and see in Rome and the Romana is wonderfully placed to see the major sights. Friendly service from staff although slightly disappointed that there was no reduction (however small or token) for the night we were unable to stay due to circumstances beyond our control.

Reviews.Title: “spotless hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonnieIreland
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 8, (5 rooms) and we all were pleased with our stay.. yes, it may be dated. but very clean, good size beds, fresh linen every day, good breakfast , great coffee. and very friendly staff, especially Daniella on reception..as I was in charge of picking hotel, I was anxious as I had 7 others to please, but their were all delighted with this hotel. The location is very good, plenty of .places to eat near by... 4 of our rooms faced the courtyard very quite, 1 room faced a very busy street, not for a light sleeper.This is 4* italian standard, nothing like 4* Irish standard, so if thinking of luxury this is not the hotel for you..but this hotel has great charm, and it was like home from home for us.... Like to say many thanks to the lovely staff , who make our visit more enjoyable... stayed 14th/18th March 2012

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Qonrad G
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and only a short walk to Piazza Barberini and a short distance walk (15 mins) to Roma Termini Train Station. Free unlimited WIFI as well.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: cincy814
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Domus Romana during a recent 4-day trip to Rome. The location is really quite good and all of the main sights are within walking distance. Our room was on the fourth floor, which has a lovely terrace. The room itself was ok; a bit dated but no real complaints as we were not in the room much. The bed could use replacing, but we had no problems sleeping after walking around the city all day. The bathroom was fine. The entire room was very clean, and housekeeping did a good job keeping the toiletries stocked. The breakfast was excellent every morning, and the staff did a good job keeping the small space stocked and clearing the tables. There were a few things that the hotel could work on improving. We found it disappointing that our room's hotel folder contained a sheet that said guests had free amenities available to them, such as complimentary wine, chocolate or fruit, bathrobes, newspaper, map, etc. When we asked, we were told it was for "special rooms only". The hotel should remove this sheet of paper from the folder if it doesn't apply to the room. Additionally, on the day of our checkout, someone inserted a key card and opened the locked door to our room around 8:30 AM - without knocking. My husband, who was getting dressed, quickly said "Hello!" and pushed the door closed. It was a decent hotel for the price we paid, but if I return to Rome I will try another 4 or 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BelfastBarclays
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be in an excellent location and convenient to most of the attractions of Rome. The staff were both helpful and friendly. Room was very good size. Even during the day the room was quiet from road noise. Breakfast was excellent. Only two negative points, air con was very nosy and the bathroom had a bit of a musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted :)”
Reviews.Author: mean1979
Reviews.Content: This isnt the place to stay if you want luxury, pools and peace and quiet. This is ideal though if you want a real flavour of rome and yet still feel comfortable and safe! Had a great time and no more than 30 mins walk from all the sites.Staff are wonderful, breakfast was great and the room was perfect for the time we spent in it. Couldnt beat this for the price we paid. Rome can be a little loud (sirens, car horns and the odd bit of shouting) and this hotel is very close to the heart of this city. I loved it, but some may not. Top tip, if you are looking for the entrance, its just on the left as you start to walk up via delle quatro fontane if you come from via Nazionalle (opposite Berzitello restaurant) .We walked straight past it twice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tim P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 25 to 29 Feb, and the experience wasn't great and as expected from what other reviewers had said. Hotel looks tired, furnishings are dated and I find it hard to believe this is a four star hotel. Breakfast room is small and claustrophobic and not fit for purpose, especially when the hotel is full. I felt sorry for the poor staff who are clearly worked off their feet, having to clear tables and keep the breakfast bar stocked - unfortunately they just can't do this and you either had to wait to find a clear table or when you did, there was limited food to choose from. Location is ok and pretty central to the sites. If you're going to the Termini, it is only a 10 minute walk. Don't let this put you off Rome, the city is brilliant; but as far as accommodation, I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: KittyTasmania
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to main sites in Rome including restaurants and shops. A supermarket is situated just a round the corner as well. Service is friendly and free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jennyann18
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 night stay at Domus Romana. Very easy to reach from the train station. This hotel is within walking distance of all major attractions of Rome and also close to bus stop for the hop on hop off service. The reception staff spoke great english and were very helpful. Our room was lovely and clean, sheets and towels changed every morning. Breakfast plentiful with good choice. We had perfect stay and also a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great time !!!!”
Reviews.Author: rod p
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Rome and our stay at the Domus Romeana Hotel. We were very pleased with the Hotel. We found that the front office staff was always very helpful with information and assistance. The room was clean and we thought they were a comfortable size. There was never any issues with the lack of hot water for showers or bath. The morning breakfast was well done and had a very nice varity of foods. When we return to Rome we will return to this Hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My dream came true!!!”
Reviews.Author: asolgal
Reviews.Content: We went there for our honeymoon! And we LOVED it!! We felt in love with the hotel, the service is the best!delicious breakfast by the garden fountain! Located in the heart of "citta vecchia" is at walking distance from anywere! We really enjoyed our nights walks to the fontana di trevi or down to piazza spagna! Bellisimoooo!!! Great pubs are near the hotel, so you can have really good food and beer or wine!!! Is the place for you romantic italian honeymoon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CissiSweden
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location. We took the Leonardo express train from the Fiumicino Airport to the Termini train station and then walked 10min (maximum) to the hotel. We walket to most of the monuments and sights of Rome from this spot (Borghese gallery, Colosseum, St Peter's Basilica&Vatican museums, Sant'Angelo, Piazza Navona, Fontana di Trevi, the Spanish Steps and many others). For those who prefer other forms of transport, there were lots of bus lines nereby, Metro line A at Repubblica was only a few minutes walk away. The reception staff spoke very good english and were helpful. We had booked a family room (for 4-6 persons) and were given a quiet, very clean room at the third floor. The room had quite a large balcony overlooking the inner yard. There was also a kitchette with microwave oven, stove, fridge and basic kitchen utensiles. The room temperature was perfect, despite it beeing December and outside temperatures below zero.This hotel served the best breakfast I've ever had at an italian hotel: nice bread, warm croissants with a variety of fillings, boiled eggs, sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, different juices, hot chocolate etc etc. We really liked this hotel and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful and friendly staff,”
Reviews.Author: Jane L
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel for families. 24 hour check in was excellent as we arrived late in the evening. Arrival was less than smooth due to taxi driver taking us 1.3 klms from Termini and charging us €25. Would recommend other travellers to check taxi has a meter before getting in!! Arrived to be greeted by Francesco who went out of his way to ensure a smooth check in. Francesco took excellent care of our family over the next five days. Hotel was within an was walk of Spanish steps, collosseum and Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Good position in Rome but the rest is horrible”
Reviews.Author: MassimoCapoccia
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel, it's more a 2+ stars or 3. There is no bar, so a cappuccino from a ordinary machine, the hotel is not clean, it's not maintained very well, it needs some painting, new wall paper, etc. The personnel needs to learn manners, at the breakfast they served fork and knives in the reverse stand. Bedrooms are big, but beds are horrible with old and too used mattress with holes. The kitchen is a joke, old and needs big time renovation. Bathrooms needs renovation as well and toilets after flushing have water running for 20 min before stopping. Nice during the night... You should get a cheap hotel, because for what you get it's too expensive. For this money or more get then a real 4 stars. I will never return here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price for Rome”
Reviews.Author: TJS1953
Reviews.Content: I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone. The rates are at the lower end for Rome and the rooms are really nice. We stayed for 3 nights in November in Room 209 (see pics). Huge room with a decent bathroom. 10 minute walk to Termini train station / Colosseum / Spanish Steps / Trevi Fountain (in different directions). Vatican about 30 min walk but plenty to see on the way! Staff really friendly, breakfast more than acceptable. Only tiny criticism was that the room was almost too big for the furniture in it! As I say, would recommend, was not disappointed and I should add that I am usually quite exacting about hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: james p
Reviews.Content: Good location..easy to get to from termini, easy to get to the main sights on bus or metro. Unexpectedly found ourselves in a suite of rooms, clean and comfortable. No hot water on the firwt night but immediately sorted out by the staff. Passable breakfast. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly staff & an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: sm1143
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location for the historic sites & the main railway station. Excellent friendly & helpful staff. Massive, very clean, room & bathroom. Free wi-fi. Huge, inclusive, breakfast buffet. This has been the best hotel choice I've made in a very long time!

Reviews.Title: “Would never recommend and never return.”
Reviews.Author: Niminy457
Reviews.Content: Pluses for this hotel as mentioned by others are handy location, and a pretty patio for the breakfast, which was acceptable. The bathroom was roomy enough and seemed clean. However, our tiny room on the third floor had no elevator and was dark and dingy and very badly in need of updating. The lack of elevator didn't matter to us, except when we had to carry our luggage down, but anyone with mobility concerns should take note. There was a large patch of damaged wall in the room that was desperately in need of repair. The safe didn't work properly and the instructions that were provided had absolutely nothing to do with its operation. As a result we had to carry our valuables all over the city. These irrelevant instructions for the safe indicate to me that the hotel is not at all concerned about guest security and this opinion is certainly supported by a previous review about a "thief in the room".. With the exception of one kind, pleasant person, the staff ranged from indifferent to "sort-of-helpful". We didn't think this hotel was good value and would never consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Worldwide2010
Reviews.Content: Wasnt too sure when booking this hotel for a four night stay sightseeing holiday due to mixed reviews. On arrival was very pleased with hotel and amenities. Breakfast's were very good with food quickly replenished. I hasten to add the hotel is located not too far from any of the highlights of the city. The price of hotel transfer advertised at the reception desk is 55 euro for 2-3 people however a taxi can easily be waved down at the front of the hotel and will only charge you 40 euro ( of the meter ). Dont forget there is also a 3 euro per night tax to be paid at the end of the stay at reception.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Terri B
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and answered all questions about places around Rome. The hotel was in a good location near many restaurants and shops and you could walk to some of the local attractions.But unfortunately it went down hill from there.We had no hot water and even after informing staff 24 hours later still no hot water,we had to request a room on another floor.The rooms were clean and spacious the tv was not working in the first room and in the second all the people were green.The breakfast was nice except as food ran out it was not replaced and the toaster didnt work it just turned the bread into dried out bread.They did say they had 24 hour desk ,but if you needed house keeping it finished at 8pm at night so requesting anything after that was not worth bothering with.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: williamtp
Reviews.Content: Good location but definitely not a four star hotel by any definition I'm familiar with (despite this being displayed everywhere). No elevator to our room and no assistance getting our bags up there. Generally poor service (with the exception of one staff member). Small room. Noisy and ineffective airconditioning. The free wifi was not effective in the room forcing me to work elsewhere in the hotel. Low quality breakfast with hard scrambled eggs even when we turned up right at the start. Coffee came out of a 'Nescafe' machine that appeared to use instant coffee.

Reviews.Title: “thief in the room”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina B
Reviews.Content: hotelroom is ok, not good not bad. However we had a thief in the room. Lucky for us we were in the room at the time (3.30 p.m.) and he, after seeing me, left the room quickly without taking anything. After reporting this immediately to reception, nothing was done about it that day. The day after we went back to reception and then it was promised to us that they were going to call police so that they could look at video of the entrance to our room. They were going to ask me then, if I would come to identify the thief. All this is a short story but it actually took about 10 times for us to go to reception and complain that something had to be done. The ONLY thing they did was blocking all the cards of every hotelguest so that this was changed with a new code. But management NEVER contacted me anymore. This gives me the only conclusion that no police was called and nothing further was done about it. This is for me totally UNACCEPTABLE !!! For those who are wandering, I refused to keep on complaining at reception after 10 times because I realised they were not going to do a lot with it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Thomas46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Romana 1 night before and 3 nights after a cruise. On our first night, we were severely jet lagged and we were given a quiet room (Room 101) reached by going through the courtyard. We slept very well as we didn't hear a sound while in that room. For the 3 nights after the cruise, we were assigned Room 504 and were shocked! We had booked a double room, but Room 504 is a large suite with a front balcony and a large terrace off the bedroom - absolutely wonderful! Hotel was fully booked so we lucked out by being upgraded. We thought sitting in the lovely courtyard on our first night was incredible enough, but the private terrace for our 3 subsequent nights was exquisite. Breakfast is also very good... there are many different things to choose from, pastries, eggs, meats, cheese, cereal, fruit, many different juices and coffees. Service was very friendly and helpful. Ignore any negative reviews on this site, we have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel and would gladly stay there again. The *only* thing I would suggest is to not take a tour with the company recommended by the hotel. This is not meant as a slight against the hotel, but we were very disappointed with the tour. It was a rather costly tour of the Colosseum, Palatine Hill and the Forum. 2.5 hours were spent at Palatine Hill and the Forum (tour guide was very informative, just wished he could walk and talk at the same time... too much standing while listening to him!), and once we arrived at the Colosseum we were told we had 10 minutes to look around. We ended up missing the bus back, but at least we got to spend more than 10 minutes at one of the most amazing sites in Rome. But as for the hotel, it is a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Francesco e Daniela”
Reviews.Author: Cornetta
Reviews.Content: We would like to extend a big thank you to all the staff at Domus Romana in particular the most friendly and helpful staff members FRANCESCO AND DANIELA. Who made us always feel welcome and at home. The excellent service made our stay in Rome one to remember always. We would not consider any other hotel to stay at. We will definitely be returning in the near future. We praise the hotel highly and rate it FIVE stars. Thank you so much, FRANCESCO AND DANIELA. Cornetta Family.

Reviews.Title: “Who gives out the stars????”
Reviews.Author: Terese333
Reviews.Content: Our five night stay at the Hotel Domus Romana left us wondering who's in charge of star-rating hotels? "Four Stars" is not even within the reach of Domus Romana. When we arrived, we were told there was no one to help us with our luggage. No bell hop in a four star hotel? Unheard of. So, my husband, my three children and I had to get our luggage upstairs to our room ourselves. Our room was spacious but by no means posh and just barely clean. For some reason there was a yucky little kitchen in it with dilapidated cabinets and counter tops. Our beds were adequate, but the pillow situation was most definitely not. So we called the front desk on our first night to request additional pillows. That was when we realized that the desk doesn't pick up the phone after 8pm. When we inquired about pillows the following day, we were told the hotel was booked to capacity, and there were no pillows to be had. For what we paid for this hotel, someone should have gone out that night and bought us some pillows. The mattresses felt more like sleeping on cardboard boxes, as well. As for breakfast, if you're planning on eating any, better be there when they open the doors. Breakfast was "served" from 7-10:30, but on the days we arrived at 9am, most of the food (and all of the croissants) were gone, and not to be replenished. The location was good, if you want to be central to the sights. But in Rome, being central to everything means being close to nothing. And the photos on the hotel's site are very deceptive. It would appear that the entrance is through a beautiful courtyard with a fountain, but that's actually an interior courtyard. Our cabbie actually had a hard time finding the building because the true entrance looks more like a service alley. Not very welcoming at all. Oh, and to top it off, the hotel's internet access was inaccessible for the last three days of our trip. So much for that.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Neilanddot
Reviews.Content: Hidden away, this hotel is the perfect base for exploring the city. The room was tidy, breakfast was simple but tasty. If you stay here you must visit Est Est Est pizzeria only 3 minutes walk away for probably the best pizza and pasta we had in Rome. The house White is also excellent (hence the name of the restaurant)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but Good Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mickey019
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and so finding a hotel in Rome that has one room for all of us is difficult. We booked a suite at the Domus Romana using frequent flier points. It was expensive, but the hotel is well managed, clean, well-maintained, and in a good location. Don't be put off by the picture of the front entrance when you look at it through Google street view. Once inside the small lobby you will find a nice large courtyard. The well stocked restaurant where we ate breakfast which was included is off the courtyard. Our suite was on an upper floor and across the hallway there was a nice rooftop terrace overlooking the courtyard. It was a great spot to relax at the end of the day. The hotel is graded at four stars which for European standards is accurate. The front desk staff was very helpful booking cars, providing advice, and giving us directions. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with our room...”
Reviews.Author: FCMR99
Reviews.Content: Relatively good location but I`m quite sure we got stuck wih one of the worst rooms they have. Room bed configuration was poor - not practical, air conditioning unit was very noisy and didn`t sufficiently chill, morning traffic outside our window was noisy. Looked around before leaving and noted that other rooms looked considerably better than ours. Complementary breakfast was ok but nothing worth writing home about. Overall disappointed with value. TV was from the 70`s. AND worst of all... couldn`t get a strong enough WIFI signal to log on to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “No Rest for the Weary”
Reviews.Author: slburns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on May 21 & 22 prior to going on a Med cruise. The room itself was alright, nothing special, but basically clean,. The morning breakfast was a nice touch. The problem with this hotel is the potential for noise. The cute little courtyard you see in the pictures along with a small conference room are rented out for events by a company that apparently is not owned by the hotel. Both nights we were there, they were rented out for 18th birthday parties. The first nigth the music blasted until about 2:30 a.m. and the second night until about 1:30 a.m. For two jet-lagged guests who were ready to go to bed at 10 p.m., this was a huge issue. When I complained to the desk clerk on the first night at around 10:30 p.m., he said they wouldn't be much longer, just needed to blow out the candles and cut the cake, but it went on for four more hours. I never dreamed there would be a second party on the Sunday night or we would have moved hotels. If it had not been for the noise, we would have been alright with this hotel, as it is close to everything, but booking here is a bit like playing Russian roulette, maybe you'll be fine or maybe you won't get any sleep. Why gamble, book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Alka
Reviews.Content: Location isn't everything. We were disappointed in our accomodations at Domus Romana. Think tired dirty Holiday Inn. Front desk staff was disinterested in the guests. The restaurant recommendation was terrible. The room was dirty, carpet and furnishings quite old. Noisy. The A/C sounded like an airplane was landing in our room. The positives: location and nice breakfast in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Linda2116
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our rooms were not ready. They held our luggage so we could begin touring the city. Between all of us, we had 3 rooms and every one was very nice. They were much larger than most. The hotel provided an incredible daily breakfast buffet which provided a great start to the morning

Reviews.Title: “Location great but rooms average”
Reviews.Author: Krishsmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Domus Romana. Our teenagers 13 and 16 had to share a fold out sofa which left no room in the lounge room. My husband and I were in the other room. The bed was hard and not very comfortable. We are on the top floor and the security lights shone all night which was annoying. The bathroom was fantastic and the towels were fluffy and clean. There was a tiny room with a bar fridge in it and that was all! Would have been nice to have tea and coffee in the room. Definitely need to update the TV. An LCD TV mounted on the wall would make more room too. Cords hanging out is not good. Breakfast was fantastic although very busy but the waiters were efficient in cleaning the tables up. Central location which was a bonus. We were out all day anyway. There's a fabulous cafe across the road which had the best pasta and expresso! Careful of the restaurant across the road on the left. The waitress delivered a more expensive meal to me even though I didn't order it.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreIrish
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great setting in a great location. Our room was v traditional, with lovely ceiling frecoes and a separate entrance room with the fridge, tv and sofa, table & chairs. The little courtyard is picturesque and the peace and quiet around there is amazing for where it is! woudl highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: KEG48
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights with our 4 sons and my mom. Had 3 double rooms and a single (ideally would have been for my mom but there was no elevator to that room on third floor. Room sizes were adequate. The 3 double rooms had kitchenettes and small dining tables. Great breakfast- everyone was satisfied with the variety of meat, cheese, pastries, cereal, fruit, eggs, bacon... Rooms were very clean! Lady at the desk during the day spoke good english and was helpful and pleasant. Gentleman in the evening didn't understand much english. One of the rooms had a lovely balcony and at MN of flag day, our sons enjoyed a great fireworks display. Our room was on the courtyard- we left the windows open and listened to the fountain. Great location- a few blocks from Repubblica metro stop and bus stops closer. Would definitely stay there again. The only down side was that during siesta, there wasn't anything for the kids to do at the hotel but sit in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good central choice”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at DR for five nights at the start of our Italian vacation. Hotel has many positives...it is located near everything, 10 minute walk to Spanish steps, shorter than that to the Trevi Fountain, etc.. Also, very close to Repubblica metro. It is well maintained, breakfast was fine. Plenty of coffee and juices, rolls, eggs, bacon. We were always able to get a table. Especially want to thank Daniela, at the desk, who went out of her way for us. She recommended nearby restaurants which were NOT touristy and were always excellent. She called them personally when no reservations were available and got us in. She was excellent. The "day" desk person was not so good. We stayed in Room 103...It is quirky with all kinds of steps and two different levels, and an uncomfortable bed. The bathroom was large with a deep tub and plenty of hot water. For those looking, I did not see any type of room service available, but there are shops including a grocery store very close and a fridge in the room. This is an excellent mid-range choice in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, cozy and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: laura_luna1223
Reviews.Content: Located on Via delle Cuattro Fontane, close to many points of interest, such as the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum and the Spanish Steps, this monastery-turned-hotel is elegant, very clean and peaceful. They offer a delicious breakfast. The personnel is professional and helpful. On the oposite side of the street and going towards the Spanish Steps, there is a little family restaurant that you should avoid. They ripped us off pretty badly with their entree of ''fungui'' (mushrooms), they also turned off the air conditionner once we sat down and they served us an expensive room-temperature beer. If you get caught, do not be shy to call the cops before you pay. I wish we would have done so.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff, Deceiving Photos”
Reviews.Author: by_jess
Reviews.Content: Negative: I don't often do bad hotel reviews but this was a hotel I would definitely not recommend to anyone. The hotel's web site is very deceiving, it is not as pretty or as lavish as it looks. It was actually quite run down and the rooms were outdated and ill-equipped. Our room had a musty smell and several of us had allergies which were badly aggrevated staying there. We stayed in February 2011 with 4 adults and 2 teenagers in a Family suite. There was one double bed, one pull out "armchair" bed, one cot and one pullout couch bed. The pullout couch was the worst sleep I have ever had in a hotel, the springs actually caused me great back pain (and I'm only in my 20s!), it was a nightmare. I ended up sleeping on the floor because it was more bearable than the bed. We were cramped in the room like sardines. It was a very small suite. Don't bother staying in the Family Suite. We realized we had forgotten our camera in the hotel room the day we left the hotel. We called the hotel to have them hold on to it for us and they were completely unhelpful. They asked us to email them with details, which we did. We did not hear back from them for 2 days after which we called again. We were then passed from one person to another on the phone. No one seemed to want to help us and we have still not heard anything from them about the camera. They were very unsympathetic and very unhelpful. Terrible customer service. We have lost all of our photos from this trip. Forgetting our camera was a simple mistake anyone could have made, which we feel very stupid for. But it was maddening to know that it was in the room and that we could have easily had it back if the staff had been at all helpful. Positive: Big bathroom in suite. The free continental breakfast was good. Free internet provided but you have to get a pass code from the front desk. Location is decent and near main Repubblica square, train station and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location would recomend it”
Reviews.Author: ALANJOHN1962
Reviews.Content: Nice small compact hotel with a continental breakfast that includes scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. Included is free WI FI from the bedroom and some of the t.v stations are in english. A nice touch is the slippers they provide in the bathroom. The termini station is nearby from which you can choose an open top bus to all the attractions where you can get on and off. Also walking distance is the Hard Rock cafe.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moraginedinburgh
Reviews.Content: Before arrival I emailed to tell the hotel that this was a special, romantic trip to celebrate an anniversary and asked for a nice and quiet room. I was emailed back confirming this. What we got was probably the noisiest room in the hotel - 1st floor, overlooking the road and the cleaner appeared to be stationed outside our room as well in that as well as the traffic noise, we had the noise of the hoover, as well as banging and crashing outside our room at 8am or earlier each morning. It was incredibly noisy (and I live close to the centre of Edinburgh)The room was basic and although had a wardrobe had no drawers. This was nothing compated to the lack of hot water. We had 1 lukewarm shower in the 5 days we stayed here - the rest were cold. The bathroom had cracked floor tiles and the shower was so low it was almost impossible to get underneath it. There was damp on the ceiling above it.. The reception staff were not the friendliest and seemed surprised at the lack of cold water but then said it "had run out". Because of this attitude we didn't "bother" them again. The free wifi throughout was not the case - it took us 2 days to access it after a number of visits to the afore mentioned not too helpful staff at reception. The breakfast was lovely but the room was cramped and not big enough - we visted in February and on some days folk had to queue to get a table. The lady who "ran" the breakfast room, however, was lovely - efficient and friendly. There were no tea and coffee facilities in the room - which you would expect in a 4 star hotel. There was nowhwere in the hotel to have a seat and a drink of any kind. I would not stay here again - I was hugely disappointed thinking that we were going to a 4* hotel for a romantic break - it was spoiled by the noise, lack of hot water, mostly unfriendly staff and basic facilities. No way is this a 4* hotel - more like a hostel. Worst holiday accommodation I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Economical, central, quaint”
Reviews.Author: aKerryman
Reviews.Content: Glad I found this hotel - it's in a nice central spot but on a quiet street. Good value, especially as breakfast included. The buffet was very good - pastries, meats, cheese, eggs, mini-sausages, streaky bacon, cereal. I haven't seen anything like this in Italy - usually a coffee and a stale pastry! Staff also very helpful - I asked for an iron and it arrived at my room 2 mins later. I was on business but had my young family in tow, and it is a good choice if travelling with kids. Just check your room has lift access - ours did but about 5 steps also. It wasn't a problem but if you have mobility issues I'd ask the hotel for advice. It's also slightly downhill from Republica, and uphill from ancient Rome (lots of hills in Rome). There is a pizzeria and a sushi restaurant across the road - we tried both and were very happy. Also lots of shops on Via Nazionale. Taxis, buses, metro or trains all within easy access. By UK/Ireland standards it's a three star plus, but they do give plenty of toiletries, towels, and slippers. By Roman standards it's good - not stunning looking but quaint. For the price you can't complain! I'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, Great locations, and Outstanding Staff.”
Reviews.Author: jbren89639
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and on top of things. When we showed up there was an issue with their hot water and they put us up in another hotel for our first night. When we returned the next day we were upgraded to a room with a balcony. There was also a bottle of Wine and some fruit waiting for us. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The breakfast was more than you could ask for. We were expecting a "continental" breakfast instead there were some hot options. As for the location you could not ask for anything more. Within a five minute walk you were at Piazza de la Republica. Form here you could jump on the subway or on one of the hop on hop off busses. The hotel was also very clean. We have decided to come back in April and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location that is off main thoroughfares, quiet and charming”
Reviews.Author: downonhudson
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to stay at the Domus Romana on a recent trip to Rome, a choice made on the basis of price, location and the charming photos posted here. The room however was darker than expected. We also were very impressed with the courtesy, and very good recommendations of DANIELA, who was the desk clerk on two shifts while we were there. She was overheard dealing with two tourists whose credit card had just been 'eaten' by an ATM machine, and she was both sympathetic, polite and business-like about how they might best deal with the problem. Having been in Rome many times before, we wanted to walk everywhere as much as possible, and felt the location was underrated by previous reviews here. We loved being near the Palazzo Barberini, and treasured an afternoon there without the crowds of other extremely busy sites during the holidays, such as St. Peter's, the Trevi Fountain or the Spanish Steps. The smaller not-so-fancy restaurants in the neighborhood were consistently good as to food choices and preparation, all offering the typical Italian menu. We enjoyed two nighttime walks through the city and walked most everywhere, except the one bus we took to St Peter's and the Vatican. That was easily accessible at the end of the hotel's street which intersects with Via Nazionale. It is not far from there to the Termini train station, nor at the other end to the Pza. Barberini far from many major streets and sites, such as the Via Sistina which leads up to the top of the Spanish Steps, or the Via Veneto. The building is a former convent and while our room was quiet, it was somewhat dark and had a slight antiseptic scent. The bathroom was brightly lit and crisply tiled, all details were new and very clean. Our daughters had a 2nd floor larger room at the back, but it had no elevator. The staff was extremely courteous about moving bags to their room. They also helped us with all questions, including busses, restaurant recommendation and airport service. They also packed breakfast for us in bags to go as we left very early on our final day. The breakfast room has a buffet, included in the room price, and is somewhat crowded but efficient. The Domus Romana is not a fancy hotel, like the nearby upscale places such as the Bernini Hotel, but for value, considerate service, comfort and tourist needs, it is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean rooms, great breakfasts, average location”
Reviews.Author: markerw
Reviews.Content: With my wife and two kids 9 and 12 years old, we enjoyed staying at this small hotel. Every morning, we awoke separately and wandered down to the outdoor breakfast tables. Continental buffet with Italian pastries hit the spot. When we needed assistance the staff were extremely helpful. (e.g., When we took the taxi to the airport, we discovered that we had left a bag at the hotel. They quickly sent it down to the airport and we were able to board the airport as planned.) The location was okay but great restaurants were a good walk away and one need to travel to the main sights. We would probably go back to this hotel again when we stay in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “pleased to find such a friendly, value for money hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: NatalieWallis
Reviews.Content: Admittedly we booked late and received a bargain rate but this hotel was very well placed just off the Via Nazionale on Via delle Quatro Fontane, within walking distance from Termini station or if travelling with luggage - a short ride on the No 64 bus! The entrance is discreet - so much so we walked passed it but look for the Hotel Zara and Domus Romana is just opposite! Check in was friendly and efficient and we were given an upgrade on the standard rooms we had booked. Traditionally furnished, beds were comfortable, linen crisp and all very clean. In August the air conditioning was very welcome and the marble floors cool for weary feet however slippers were provided and would be welcome in the cooler months. Breakfast was self-service with juices, water, cold meats, cheese, yoghurt, cereal bread, preserves and pastries. The bread was not day-fresh but given that this was annual holiday week, passable - there was certainly enough to satisfy our hungry teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Experience”
Reviews.Author: Coughlin4
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, fantastic service, excellent clean, quiet and cool rooms, great courtyard, cant recommend enough. Traveled through three countries in Europe over two weeks and this was absolutely the best stay we had. Wish I could give 6 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not a 4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: coloso1
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in room 106--its old and not very clean looking--especially the shower cubicle. The curtains in then bathroom were insufficient to provide privacy if the lights were on. The hotel feels more like a 3 star hotel aspiring to be something more. The breakfast was very ordinary and you can get better in any cafe. The worst thing was when some friends and I turned up at reception at 10pm to request a taxi, and were kept waiting 5 minutes by Francesco who was busy on the phone in front of us making arrangements to go out with his friends that evening. Its when one of our party who understood all he was saying, surprised him with her fluent Italian that he leapt to our asssitance. All in all a disappointing 3 days at the Domus. WOuld not reccomend it fi a 4 star hotel is what you are after.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Near metro and attractions, large rooms, average facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Bleasurer
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very large which for Rome is quite unusual. Quite location yet within striking distance of all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Famlies”
Reviews.Author: Lynches
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel - good value in an expensive City. Room (suite) was ideal for 5 of us (would also have been great for 6). Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast just what you would want - nothing more, nothing less. Location very good - a 15 minute wasy walk to Piazza Navona. Peaceful place - lovely courtyard. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Surprize-small room!”
Reviews.Author: joeyvinsho
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my Italian vacation with my wife and adult daughter. Since we were essentially 3 adults, I searched Trip Advisor for a hotel that would provide a larger-than-average room for us. The reviews of Domus Romana were very good, and I noticed that most of the reviews mentioned the "spacious rooms", so I booked a Triple Room and looked forward to our stay. Needless to say, I was quite surprized when we checked into room 107, with one queen bed that took up most of the room and a cubbyhole of a second room squeezed over the entrance arch of the hotel! Of course, when I went to the front desk, they said that they were completely booked, so there was nothing to do. It was also incredibly noisy! All that being said, everything else about the hotel - the breakfast buffet, the location, the cleanliness - was just fine. Just make sure to call ahead, and don't stay on the first floor!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, small back yard”
Reviews.Author: heheho
Reviews.Content: The room we (myself, my mother and my aunt) got was a large, air conditioned room with a classic look, and with a tiny balcony outwards the street. Despite the last mentioned - I did not get disturbed by any traffic-noise. We ate breakfast in the back yard of the hotel - with possibilities of eating both inside and outside. The yard has got a small fountain, and the overall look isn't exactly "breath-taking", but with a nice atmosphere - as it was quiet except from little birds flying between the roof tops. The variety in the breakfast buffet is not very impressive, but this was not a big issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: zemuzzy
Reviews.Content: Very good location and had big rooms,. The breakfast room was to small and the breakfast didn't have many choices.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer024
Reviews.Content: If you are loking for a good value hotel convenient location in Rome then this is it, don't search any more - it's over! We had a lovely four day stay here, rooms were superb, very spacious, couldn't fault a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: vercat067
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights - Staff is great. (Thanks Cecilia) Clean place. Great contiental breakfast. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: rottiefans
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were pleasantly surprised by the convenient location (walking distance to most major sights and shops). Even though it is just off a busy road it is quiet as is located around a tranquil courtyard. Breakfast was excellent quality for Italy and reception staff friendly. We were able to store our luggage for many hours after checking out at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Domus Romana a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaCoach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Romana in June 2009 after having consulted Trip Advisor prior to booking our travel package. The hotel is in a great location in Rome, very close to the Termini subway, bus, and train station. Rome is a city where you can walk everywhere and the Domus Romana is easily within walking distance of most attractions. Our bedroom had a queen bed, single pull out sofa, and a cot was brought in by staff. The room was quite large, very high ceilings, and our two windows opened out onto Quattro Fontane. The windows also had black out curtains which were great at keeping out the light. Our bathroom was very large, tub/shower combination, single sink well lit with a large mirror, toilet, and bidet. There was an electrical adapter built into the hair dryer attached to the wall. The floors throughout the hotel are marble and you will not hear any noise from below you. There is a small elevator that holds four people which services each floor. Taking the stairs is great exercise as the high ceilings mean that the floors are not the standard height. Cleaning staff were quick to change the sheets each morning but did not clear or clean used dishes during our stay. The kitchenette was helpful and the refrigerator was quite large to hold anything we might have purchased to eat or drink. The cleaning staff were more than happy to provide us with extra towels which were large and soft. The breakfast supplied each morning from 7am -10am was delicious. As expected, there were no hot food items but what was available was plentiful and readily restocked by Nita, a very friendly Phillipino server. Pastries, a toaster, sliced bread, and panini buns were always available. Sliced salami and ham along with swiss cheese were available each morning. Coffee, hot milk, and hot water were available for drinks. Nita was able to make a delicious cafe latte if given the time. There were two dispensers of juice - pineapple and some sort of citrus drink, both probably made from powder crystals and not freshly squeezed. In terms of breakfast cereals there was corn flakes, cocoa rice krispies, and delicious granola. There were three fruit selections, pineapple slices, prunes and another one which I cannot remember. Jam, butter, nutella, and honey were all available. We ate indoors but on a warm sunny morning it was possible to eat at small cafe tables in the courtyard. The tables seated four people unless you put a couple of tables together. The tables all had tablecloths and cloth napkins which was a nice touch and were cleared quickly by Nita. Reception staff were helpful, especially Andre and David. Internet access through two personal computers cost 2 euros for 30 minutes. The reception staff were helpful by providing printed directions to attractions and we did not always have to rely on the computers near the reception area. There is a restaurant across the street called Berzatolli (sic) which supplied good pizza eat in or take away. A margherita pizza cost 5 or 6 euros. There is a grocery store around the corner on Via Nationale a couple of blocks down called Despar which stocks just about anything you would want from a grocery store. Towards the end of our stay the tourist season was just beginning to hit full stride and the breakfast room was becoming quite busy. Please keep this in mind as the room is long and narrow and can feel quite tight if busy. Please feel free to email if you would like more info.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: bumbletraveller
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Domus Romana - once we found it. Walked straight past on the first time - not fun in 30 degrees. You might mistake it for the entrance for a side street, there is an archway and a sort of pebbled floor on the left hand side if you are walking in the direction from the train station. Look out for this and you'll be fine! Room was lovely and spacious and got lovely and cool after a long day of sightseeing. Thoroughly recommend the Da Ricci (Est Est Est) pizza place not far away which is a busy studenty place that does delicious pizza at bargain prices. We felt the location was very good - central to lots of sights, only took about 10-5 minutes to get to most places. We only got the tube/bus to the catacombs just on the outskirts - which is well worth a visit. Just up the road is a tiny bar so you can stock up on water for the day - and for a beer or ice cream on your way back. Lovely courtyard area was very pretty. Good choice at breakfast - although it could get quite busy and things weren't always replenished very quickly - this was our only downpoint - we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of tranquility in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: HAU74
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance of the train staiton, but without the noise of the railway, this hotel was an ideal location to explore the sights of Rome. Most places were within walking distance, for those that weren't the bus stop was a two minute walk. TRhe hotel is located off of the main roads and set around a peaceful courtyard with it's own little fountain. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Whilst the rooms we had (3 couples) varied greatly , they were all very well equiped and beautifully spacious. Domus Romana does not have a restaurant, but does have a breakfast room where full continental breakfast is provided. There are cafes and shops just across the road and plenty of restaurants nearby, so the lack of restaurant really was not an problem. We'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: polivare
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awsome, we stay in many hotels in the past trip to rome, but this one is beautiful. The hotel is located near the main avenues in Rome, a little door is the front door. A small reception, but the rooms are large, beautiful, big bathroom, a table to seat with two seat, hardwood floors in the room, beautiful decoration. The size of the room is very very large for Rome standards. The breakfast is large and in a room in the first floor where they have an internal patio that you see in the photos of the adversisment of the hotel . We try the Gioberti, not very good, old, very good breakfast, The Ariston, very tiny tiny europen size, you will have to carry your luggage around the satirs every room in the lobby has stairs. I recommend this hotel largelly. You will love it...

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sixto_2000
Reviews.Content: This was our third time in Rome (previously in 1980 and 1984) and enjoyed every single minute of it. The Domus Romana is a nice and very charming small hotel very well located even for us that are more than 60 years old. There are several small places to eat, have a beer or a glass of wine in the same street. Just around the corner there is the Via Nazionale, where you can find anything you want; shops, restaurants, a 24 hrs drug store and a small super market (all these within 1 minute walk). If you walk 5 minutes you are in the Piazza della Repubblica, where you can take the Metro, and you can go from there to any where because one stop from that station there is the Plaza Termini where you can take all the buses and trains to any where within the city or elsewhere. There you can buy a one day pass, that you can use to take unlimited any bus or Metro for one day (4 Euros) or the three days for 11 Euros. Along the Via Nazionale you can take a bus to St. Peter´s Square or any where in the city (bus stop 2 minutes from the hotel). The room that they assigned was clean, spacious, with a nice kitchenette, very beautifully decorated ceilings (wood work) but a little bit dark in spite of several lamps. There were some details in the bathroom like shower caps, shampoo and a nice pair of slippers. The breakfast room was cozy, specially in February when Rome was very cold. The breakfast included coffee,juice, bread, croissants, meat, cheese, cereals, yogurt, pastries, cake, hot chocolate, in a nice, clean atmosphere. The two persons that are taking care of everything are very efficient and discrete. You can ask for expresso coffee and immediately you have it. In summary you can start your day very well fed and spend most of the day until lunch. There was a toaster for the bread and I mention it because some one who wrote a review says that there wasn´t. They have internet in the lobby at a reasonable price and once I asked for a nice restaurant for my wife and myself and the reccomendation was good, although some how expensive. The cafeteria around the corner in Via Nazionale serves excellent spaghettis with shrimps (8 Euros) and a very nice meat with vegetables (14 Euros). There also you can have pizza, have a beer or wine. Drinks in Rome are 5 Euros every where (beer, soft drinks, wine). In summary the hotel is very well located, transportation is readily available very close to the hotel and you can walk any where from the hotel. 15 minutes to the Fontana di Trevi and from there you can start your walked tour to all interesting places in Rome. You can go to Plaza della Repubblica and take the Metro for Piazza di Spagna. Walk 20 minutes to the Colosseum, 10 minutes to Monumento a Vittorio Emanuele and so you are right in the middle of everything. I would reommend it to any one in my family and surely when we return to Rome, will stay in the Domus Romana.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: hopegreaux
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very happy with the accomodations and service at the Domus Romana. We were on the top floor and had a huge balcony, practically our own courtyard really. I wish the weather had been slightly warmer, we would have taken advantage of it. The room had a separate sitting area with a small cooktop and fridge. The tv wouldn't give us any satelite at first but the front desk sent someone up very quickly to get that fixed. The bed was very comfortable and it was nice that it was a king size bed. I wasn't really expecting that. They had extra pillows and blankets in the closet if needed. The bathroom was very clean and had everything we needed. The one glitch we had was the elevator. For one whole day it was out of service. Not so bad going down in the morning but after a full day of walking Rome it wasn't so great going up the stairs. When we got back and it still wasn't working we decided to just out to dinner first. it was a little early but treking up 6 flights of stairs twice just wasn't in the cards! The location was fantastic. It was an easy walk to many sights and if the one you wanted to see was out of they way, the metro station was quite close. Two stations really. The breakfast was fantastic! Great coffee and a very large assortment of breads, cereals, meats and cheese. When I got home I went on a search for a particular cheese we had there and came pretty close. Just a small reminder of such a great trip...

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in the busy centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jackand-Yorks
Reviews.Content: Lovely old monastery, carefully adapted to retain lots of original features, such as arched/beamed and/or decorated ceilings and thick walls.. Rooms were large, comfortable and very clean, as was our bathroom. Rooms are set round a central courtyard, with a fountain. The breakfast room opens off this, and there are tables outside which are great for relaxing with a glass of wine. [Buy your own and store it in the minibar, as there isn't a bar in the hotel.] There's a lounge on the second floor with a fantastic ceiling - we didn't use it, but may have done if the weather hadn't been so good. Breakfast is a continental buffet, but with a good range of breads and pastries, ham and cheese, some cereals, fruits and juices Staff at reception were very helpful and pleasant, and seemed fluent in a range of languages. Much of Rome is walkable from here, but there are bus stops just round the corner, and a metro stop about 5 mins. walk away. There's a wide choice of places to eat: we liked Restaurant Strega (Piazza Viminale, 5 mins walk), That's Amore (via Agostina de Pretis - 6 mins - good food but young waiter was a bit surly [or possibly v. shy]). Best of all was Rinaldi's (Via Parma. About 10 mins. walk, excellent food and service, a small glass of champagne on arrival and limoncella before you leave). But avoid the Trattoria Barberini (same street as hotel, 3 mins walk, but garish interior and very indifferent food). We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Domus Romana again, but next time would get to grips with the air conditioning (we should have asked staff for help - it was effective but noisy) and not leave the windows open, as the streets around are busy and the Italian drivers like using the horn!. Shutting the windows cut out all the noise, and it would possibly be a good idea to ask for a room facing the courtyard rather than the street. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tishNchris
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Italy with another couple and Rome was our third stop on the trip. The hotel itself is in a great location, in walking distance to everything (except the Vatican, you would need to take the bus- but its very easy). The people who worked at the front desk of the hotel were not always the friendliest and in turn, we didn't bother asking them anymore questions after about a day or two. Our room smelled everyday like someone went #2, it was gross. Our air conditioning didn't work, it was hot as hell in our room and our shower was literally a 3x3 box you couldn't even shower in. We asked to move rooms, and they were not able to do so, luckily we spent very little time in our room. The breakfast was ok, and the hotel itself was not bad looking, and the most important factor which is the location, was really great, but for a 4 star hotel, it was pretty disappointing. It's definitely more a 2.5 or 3 at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: eMBieAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 days visit to Rome. Me and my wife we loved the Domus Romana.( Via delle Quatro Fontane). I can highly recommend this hotel to fellow travelers when visiting the eternal city. The Domus is a small hotel, means quiet, located in the city center, in walking distance from Trevi, Pantheon and even from the Colloseum, The staff is very friendly,, especially the girls at reception who gave very good tourist information about transport to sites outside historical center. Rooms...I think there was not one room the same as the other! our first one was quite small but, after asking, changed in a larger one, and...courtyard view. Good bed (!) bathroom complete, mini bar (fridge). Quiet at nigth. Room was in perfect condition and cleaning was also good. Breakfast was good, nothing hot but plenty other stuff, here also very quiet and peaceful. Supermarket "De Spar" arround the corner in Via Nazionale (very good to buy drinks and food). Beware for restaurants in the quarter of Trevi and Pantheon, A BIG CHEAT !!! Check was never correct, they cut my chickenbrest in two peaces and said a had two ??!! This was the same in every establisment in this neighbourhood ! If you see no pricelist (and even then...) don't go there ! Reception recommended restaurant "Gioia Mia" Via degli Avignonesi 34, 500 m NNW from hotel, good food and no surprises with the bill. Thank you Domus Romana.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely staying again”
Reviews.Author: onlyworks2travel
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough to describe the amazing experience I had staying at this hotel. Upon arrival, my husband and I were extremely tired from our 12 hour flight, starving and desperately in need of a shower. We arrived at the hotel, and the staff was extremely welcoming. Our room needed a little tlc, but was clean, comfortable and they provided a tv with satilite reception, so we were able to watch all of our favorite shows from home. The hotel is very quiet at night, and the breakfast buffet was quite desireable. We ate there every morning of our 5 night stay. It is very close to the Spanish steps, and other attractions. All in all, my experience with this hotel was great. It is not the Hyatt or Westin, but definitely a comfortable, affordable option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting major sights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: budgieCardiff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located just off the Via Nazionale and is within walking distance of many of the major tourist attractions such as the Fontane de Trevi, The Spanish steps as well as being near the 64 bus route that takes you to St Peters. The main bus/train station is no more than 6 miutes walk away. The staff were friendly and very helpful, providing us with information about how to use the public transport system and where to eat in the evenings. The hotel is currently being refurbished but this did not cause us any inconvenience. Our first room was facing the street and when we mentioned that it was a little noisy due to the road being relaid, we were offered an alternative room immediately and given assistance to move rooms. The rooms are cleaned to a high standard, the beds confortable and the linen fresh. It helped that we had a travel kettle with us as we could make our own hot drinks as and when we liked. The breakfast was good, the dining room small but clean with space to sit outside in good weather, There is a small Spa supermarket just around the corner that is handy for bottled water, fruit etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookie1001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Romana for two nights mid March and were pleased with our choice. The hotel is quite central and is handy for walking around the sights. Walking is probably the best way to get around Rome from here as the buses are usually quite crowded and when using the Metro you miss out so much. Be prepared for sore feet and legs if you don't have good walking shoes! The hotel receptionists were very polite and efficient. We put our luggage into the small luggage deposit as soon as we arrived and set out to see the sights. There are a lot of good eating places nearby so we were glad that the hotel does not offer half board. The continental breakfast was OK. The room was clean and comfortable with Sky TV [not much in English - but this didn't matter] . It did get very warm at night even with the window open so I presume that it could be quite unpleasant in the heat of summer. Having the window open let in a bit of city noise but the traffic didn't get moving until about 7.30am so this wasn't a problem. Out and about around Rome, there is so much too see. The Coleseum is a must do. Don't worry about the big queue's as they move quite quickly. If you have children they can get reduced entry fees to the attractions but you must have ID [passport etc.] to prove their age. There are hundreds of guides vieing for your attention - wanting around 10 euros per person to take you around [we made our own way quite easily!] All the main historical sites are busy with street vendors pushing cheap rubbish at you and get tiresome after a while. Don't miss the ice creams - they are really very good! Also be aware that drinks etc; from the street vendor vans are very expensive [ 4 euros for a small bottle of Fanta!] but this could be expected in a capital city like Rome. We have a guide book with us but rarely used it. The hotel provided a map that was a lot more use. Having a wander about and not sticking to a planned route makes for a much more relaxed visit. All in all then, a good hotel in a good position and ideal for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel in the Middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: funkeyminiman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Romana for 6 nights over Valentines. This was our first visit to Rome and I must say when we arrived at the street the hotel was on, my first thoughts where what have I booked! The street was dirty, busy with traffic and shops. We walked past the entrance to the hotel as it is set back in an archway. But I must say once inside the reception I was presently surprised it was very clean and inviting and the staff very friendly and helpful. There was very little in the way of attractions and local information brochures but they did supply the best street map for free. Our room was on the 1st floor overlooking the main road, which meant we did hear some traffic but the windows and curtains do block out most of the noise. The bed was a double and very comfortable, Sky TV in every language except English, good wardrobe space and a nice bathroom with a pretty good shower. There was also a mini bar in the room, they never complained when we filled the fridge up with our own beer and water. There was even free slippers and a good selection of goodies in the bathroom. Breakfast was included in the price, meats, cheese, fruit, pastries a good selection, the only downside was that there was no toaster. But there was plenty to keep you going. The location of the hotel was OK, it was pretty central to get to everywhere by either bus, taxi or foot. We are slow walkers and it took us about 15 mins to walk to Termini Station and about the same to get to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. But if you don't fancy walking the buses are very frequent and an experience you must have. The drivers think they are Sterling Moss and speedy driving over the cobbles is not for the faint hearted. After reading lots of things about Rome, my biggest mistake was to think that people dress up smart all of the time. People do dress up in the evening but during the day, jeans and trainers are fine. Please don't sacrifice your feet by not packing something very comfy to wear. As a lot of the walking is on cobbles and up and down steps your feet do suffer. Recommends The one ticket I would recommend buying from the TI is a Rome Pass http://www.romapass.it/english/index.html. It costs €20 and gives you entry into 2 places of interest and a 3 day bus pass. The buss pass on its own is €11 and entry into the Coliseum is also €11 and you have to queue. With the Rome pass you walk straight past the queue put your ticket in the machine and walk straight in. Hard Rock Cafe - If you want to visit here it is worth making a reservation on the website to get a seat. We went on a Sunday night as I had made a reservation for 7pm, I know that sounds early but places close early on a Sunday. The place was packed and there was a 2 hour wait for a table. As with any restaurant that is popular it is worth making reservations ahead of time Open Top Bus - Walk up to the Termini Station and get tickets to go on an open top bus. There are many companies offering their services and you will pay around €16 for a day pass that allows you to hop on and off. This is best done on the first day so you can see where everything is. It is also worth jumping on when it gets dark as the sights look great all lit up. Don't expect to get any good photos on the night trip as the driver never hangs around for long.

Reviews.Title: “What a WONDERFUL place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: keiras
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the lobby... we felt like we had found "our home away from home".. The rooms were perfect with the kitchenettes. The housekeeping and front desk staff were extremely helpful. We were assisted with directions, sight-seeing suggestions and even dinner reservations for New Year's Eve!!! We could walk to many attractions and the local restaurants were excellent as well. We would (and have) recommend this hotel to anyone vising Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Lousy Service!”
Reviews.Author: AAADawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Domus Roma in early December of 2007. The hotel itself is very nice with beautiful common areas and the room was excellent (family room). The problem that we had was with the service we received. The lift in the hotel is very small even by European standards. It was next to impossible to get on the lift in the Mornings because the cleaning staff had to use it to do their job. This made it difficult to go down for breakfast and go back to the room to get ready for sight seeing. The staff thought it was hilariously funny every time the lift doors would open and 8 - 10 guests would be standing there waiting. This was quaint for the first 10 times it happened but it soon got old. Another issue was the attitude of the staff, especially the front desk staff. They had told us upon check in that they had free internet access and a free car park. We parked our rental in the "free car park" only to find that when we claimed it that the free car park was actually 35 Euro a day!!! The free Wi-Fi access is simply a lie...it does not exist. I took my Wi-Fi finder all over the hotel and I never found a hot spot. I was told that it didn't work in the entire hotel but the network that cost 15 Euro an hour worked every where. I didnt try to find out if this was so. Finally the concierge was no help at all...they could not reccomend a Restaurant nor any tours.....they simply directed us to the brochure rack and wished us luck. One of our party speaks Italian fluently and over heard the front desk clerk and the Concierge making rude comments about every single guest that walked by the desk. she confronted them, in Italian, and of course they were dismayed at being caught. I would probably stay at this Hotel again BUT with the competition for travel $ in Rome I will look for something different on my next trip to the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Place”
Reviews.Author: Avila290
Reviews.Content: The Domus Romana exceeded my expectations for a hotel in Europe. The hotel was very clean and the lobby looked very modern. The room was very clean with the exception of some stains on the wall and carpet, however, the hotel did provide slippers. The TV was great, they use the Sky Network and this allows guests to access many different channels and for the guest to select the language of the channel. Our view of the courtyard was pretty and the trickling water from the fountain at night was soothing. The Italian breakfast in the morning, which is included, was decent. It contained meats, cheeses, cereals, breads and juices. Workers were very pleasant and spoke excellent English. Only major complaint was that one night they held an event with loud music there and it didn't end until midnight. I would definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: admo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights October 2007. Staff very friendly, room clean and modern with sufficient space and everything working. Plenty of hot water in the shower. Breakfast was a reasonable selection. The hotel is within walking distance of all major attractions and the area around it seemed safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a girlie weekend in Rome, staying at the Domus Romana. We flew into Ciampino, took the number 3 bus to the Termini (6 Euro each) and from there walked to the hotel which we didn't think was that easy to find as it doesn't have a hotel sign up outside but once you find Via Delle Quattro Fontane the hotel is through an arch on the left. Reception will not allow check in before 2pm but you can leave your luggage and fit in a spot of sight seeing if you have spare time. As there were four of us we had two twin rooms. The first room was on the second floor (201), very comfortable and clean with a side aspect through two shuttered windows. The bathroom was lovely with a large walk in shower. The second room (504) was up on the fifth floor and was more like a suite with front and rear aspect, both with terraces. The bathroom was quite small and only a corner shower which wasn't at all powerful. Both rooms were more than adequate for our needs. Breakfast is pretty good with a selection of breads, cereals, pastries, meat and cheese, jam, tea, coffee, hot chocolate. The only thing we did miss was tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms and lack of provision at the hotel for a drink of any kind. If you return to the hotel for an afternoon cuppa you will be directed to the bar up the road. We even tried to organise a drink via room service but there isn't any (room service that is). If you are going to use the public transport system you can buy bus tickets in the coffee shop across the road. Buses are very easy to use, buy a 1 Euro ticket and you can use it any amount of times for 75 minutes (punch it in the machine when you get on the first bus) or 4 Euros will buy you 24 hours travel. You can use them on the bus and metro. Our favourite bus was the number 64 (go out onto Via Nazionale and turn right - you'll see the bus stops) which runs almost through the centre of Rome and stops within reach of most attractions including the Trevi Fountain (which is also walking distance from the hotel), Piazza Navonna and the Vatican. Be aware though that buses are mostly standing only and there seems to be no limit on the number of passengers allowed on - we were packed in like sardines. We found Piazza Navonna the BEST place to eat with a good choice of restaurants and always lots going on - artists, human statues, entertainers ...... Hope this all helps you if you're going to Rome. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: tourist148
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three-night stay at the Domus Romana. All in all it was very nice. The rooms are very clean, a good size and have comfortable beds, and we had a nice view of the courtyard (although they seem to carrying out some work at the moment and there was some noise, not bad though). The bathrooms are average, spotlessly clean, but the shower cubicle was a bit small. There is a nice basket of toiletries, shower gel, shampoo, soap, shower cap, even a sewing kit and shoe cleaner and the free slippers is a nice touch. The breakfast room is nice and the food was good, there was the usual continental selection, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bread rolls, cheese, ham, salami, croissants, cakes, toast and jams, biscuits, tea coffee, hot chocolate and juices, I don't see what else you could want. The hotel is in a good position, the nearest metro station is 5 minutes walk away at Republicca, the Trevi fountain takes about 10 minutes to walk to, good place to go for a stroll after dinner and get an ice-cream. Avoid the touristy restaurants around the Trevi, they are very average in all ways, go down some of the side streets and look for a trattoria, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: AndrewA411
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple, was just gorgeous. Had a very nice courtyard with fountain. The triple had a huge "Common Room" with a pullout bed, cooker, minibar & Refrigerator. Also had satellite TV & 2 couches. There was another bedroom with 2 twin beds. Bathroom was decent, nothing special. The Breakfast was decent and was nothing special either. Hotel is in a great location, about a 5 minute walk to Train Station, just a few steps from busstops including the 110 Hop On/Off Bus & just a few minute walk from major sights. I'd recommend it to Anyone, Anytime, is a great hotel with a friendly staff and gorgeous rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawnr3005
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a weekend in Rome and stayed at the Domus Romanus hotel, it is close to the main sights of Rome and also the Termini so a good location. It was nice and quiet and the room although quite basic was comfortable and clean and most importantly had a/c!!!! The staff were pleasant and helpful. Would recommend a visit. Be careful though of a restaurant down the road, not part of the hotel mind, it was only a 5 min walk on the same side of the road, you go down stairs to get to it, they tried to rip us off and another couple so be careful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: lovely staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Little_Hummingbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Romana mid July and had an absolutely wonderful time.
