On the day of our arrival the air conditioning broke down and we were immediately directed to another 4star hotel around the corner. A very elegant solution. When we could check into the Domus Romana the next morning, we were very pleasantly surprised about the room: it was huge! The owner told us it was the nicest room in the hotel, with a living room and a separate bedroom, and even a small kitchen area. So if you have the chance, ask for room no 304. It has huge windows and looks out onto the lovely patio with fountain. It's located away from the street, so the room is very quiet. Breakfast was less elaborate than we expected (I'm being fussy but I did miss freshly squeezed orange juice and a morning egg...) but that was absolutely the only minor thing about the hotel. Staff was very friendly and the owner was extremely helpful and always smiling (even in times of crisis when the airco broke down). And as other reviews mention all sights and the Termini train station are very close to the hotel's location. I would recommend spending the first day(s) just walking around, not only to the big tourist attractions, but also into small cobblestone streets that bring you to the most divine cafes and restaurants. I do have to admit that we were pretty exhausted after 3 days of walking because of the heat, so on our last day we took taxis everywhere. (! Some extra advice if you take a taxi within the city limits: always check that the taxi driver has its meter on no. 1, which is the cheaper rate. No 2 only applies outside the city limits, e.g. when they drive you to the airport. Remember that you're in Italy and they try to deceive tourists whenever they can. I was lucky to read up on that and was actually laughing when a taxi driver tried to pull that one on us ignorant tourists. He quickly said scusi and changed it back to no. 1). Anyway yes, I can recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome for a short break and will definitely come back (after all, we did throw a coin into the Trevi fountain).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: sleepy510
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Romana last week for 6 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to everything. Just up the street from the Spanish Steps, 10 minutes to the train station and all major attractions. Staff were always pleasant and helpful. Room was exactly what you would want in Rome; a place to shower and sleep. Air conditioning was working. Rooms were cleaned every day and towels were changed. The breakfast was fantastic and got us off to a good start in the morning. There is great shopping close by in all directions. Internet access if available in the lobby for 6 Euros for an hour of time. I will definately stay at this hotel again when I hopefully return to the wonderful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ti amo Domus Romana”
Reviews.Author: SelenaA
Reviews.Content: My partner and i came back from staying at the Domus Romana and in one word 'WOW!!!'. The hotel was absolutely amazing and the rooms were very clean and were cleaned everyday with fresh towels, and air conditioned at no extra charge which was a bonus as it was so hot outside, also a mini bar and sky TV what more could you ask for. There was also a supermarket on the via nationale which is 2 minutes away if you need to get in supplies. The breakfast buffet was wonderful there was a large selection that you can fill up on before you go exploring around the city. I wouldn't recommend a taxi if you can help it they charged us 31 euros just to go about 5 miles from the termini - so if your brave to save money, walk its not as far as you'd think ,we walked back to the termini for our return transfer back to the airport it took us about 5 - 10 mins to get there. The hotel is not far from the Trevi Fountain (My favorite place) its about 5 min walk and the Piazza di Spagna is about 10 - 15 mins if you follow the Quattro Fontane road. If I ever come back to Rome I will definately be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bxbomberfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the first week of April 2007 and the hotel is excellent! Staff, room, breakfast, everything was just great. It is perfectly located close to the main train station (Termini) so you dont have to spend the 60 Euros on a taxi from the airport. An 11 Euro, 30 minute train ride, then a 10 minute walk and you are there. Everything is close, with a worst case 1 hr walk to the Vatican. Most sights are less than a 30 minute walk away. We had a 3rd floor room that faced the street and the noise was not bad at all. Good windows kept it outside. In the morning you can open the window and breathe in the city. Its alive with the hustle and bustle of Via National just a few feet away. We loved this place and would not stay anywhere else should we ever return to rome. There is a supermarket around the corner that provides for any in room food and in the other direction there is a McDonalds for those who get homesick (even though its not the same).

HotelInfo.Name: Domus Romana Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Delle Quattro Fontane, 113, 00184 Rome, Italy
